alert.note: Alert for Clay; Dickinson; Geary; Ottawa (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 12 at 9:13PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Dickinson, northwestern Geary, southeastern Ottawa and southern Clay Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 913 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Longford to 5 miles east of Manchester to near New Cambria. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abilene, Chapman, Solomon, Enterprise, Manchester, Niles, Milford Lake, Moonlight and Talmage. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 267 and 286. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for central, north central, northeastern and east central Kansas.
